TopicTitle: Chang'e 3 has successfully landed on the moon!

Articles.Content:
Celebrate, citizens of the world, for another probe has set foot on the arid surface of our only natural satellite.

http://www.planetary.org/blogs/emily-lakdawalla/2013/12140619-change-3-has-successfully-landed.html

What does this mean to the future of other space programs? How I see it, this landing was a matter of national pride and... to a certain point... a b****slap to USA's government for not supporting NASA like it should. China has proven they can into space.
Yes, howeever, China does not have the capitalism for a private company that will (without government funding) put people and supplies into space.
I think there's another thread in the Science lab that is talking about this, but either way, Congrats China. Maybe we can become better friends in the future and explore space together.

Please use the existing topic for this mission:

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/50149-Moon-landing-2013-%28Chang-e-3%29

To avoid duplicate threads on the same topic, this thread will be closed.
